title.narrative: CAPACITY BUILDING, LEGAL POLICY FRAMEWOR

description.narrative: Key national actors have the technical capacity and evidence to develop and implement appropriate regulatory and accountability frameworks, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: A child protection system established in 3 districts and documented to inform a national child protection system

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Key national actors have the technical capacity and evidence to develop and implement appropriate regulatory and accountabilityframeworks

description.narrative: Key national actors, including the MoGCDSW, Malawi Police Service and the Judiciary, have increased technical capacity and a robust evidence base, including routine administrative data, to develop and implement regulatory and legislative frameworks for child protection. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/12/2018

title.narrative: Policy and/or legislative change to improve children's rights to protection introduced with UNICEF support/advocacy
No of districts producing quarterly reports from CPIMS
Proportion and number of children whose births are registered (disaggregated by sex and age: under 5, between 5-17)
Percentage of districts that have a free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration (in accordance with national legal requirements)
Child-sensitive national risk management plan addressing risks related to child protection in emergencies is in place
